{{Disambig}}

'''Achievements''' may refer to:

== ''Minecraft'' ==
=== ''Bedrock Edition'' ===
* [[Achievement]] – the achievement system {{in|Bedrock}}.
** [[Trophies]] – the same system under a different name for the ''PlayStation'' consoles.

=== ''Java Edition'' ===
* [[Achievement/Java Edition]] – the outdated system used in older versions of ''Java Edition''.
* [[Advancements]] – the successor of the previous achievement system.

==== Commands ====
* [[Commands/achievement]] – a command used to grant or remove the player an achievement in older versions of ''Java Edition''.
* [[Commands/advancement]] – a command used to grant or remove the player an advancement.

=== Legacy Console & ''New Nintendo 3DS'' editions ===
* [[Achievement/Legacy Console and New Nintendo 3DS editions]] – the achievement system for [[Legacy Console Edition]] and the ''[[New Nintendo 3DS Edition]]''.

== ''Minecraft Earth'' ==
* [[Earth:Challenges|Challenges]] - a mechanic used to guide the player into features of the game while earning [[Earth:Experience|experience]] simultaneously. 

== ''Minecraft Dungeons'' ==
* [[Dungeons:Achievement|Achievement]] – the achievement system {{in|dungeons}}.
** [[Dungeons:Trophy|Trophy]] – the same system under a different name for the ''PlayStation'' consoles.

== ''Minecraft Legends'' ==
* [[Legends:Achievement|Achievement]] – the achievement system {{in|legends}}.
** [[Legends:Trophy|Trophy]] – the same system under a different name for the ''PlayStation'' consoles.

== ''Minecraft: Story Mode'' ==
* [[Story Mode:Achievement|Achievement]] – the achievement system {{in|story}}.
** [[Story Mode:Trophy|Trophy]] – the same system under a different name for the ''PlayStation'' consoles.

== Tutorials ==
* [[Tutorial:Achievement guide|Achivement guide]] – a guide from the Minecraft Wiki to help players obtain achievements {{in|Bedrock}} and [[Legacy Console Edition]].
